org.apache.nemo.runtime.common.optimizer.pass.runtime

Class DataSkewRuntimePass

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.nemo.common.pass.Pass
      • org.apache.nemo.runtime.common.optimizer.pass.runtime.RuntimePass<Pair<StageEdge,Map<Object,Long>>>
        • org.apache.nemo.runtime.common.optimizer.pass.runtime.DataSkewRuntimePass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, BiFunction<PhysicalPlan,Pair<StageEdge,Map<Object,Long>>,PhysicalPlan>

    public final class DataSkewRuntimePass
extends RuntimePass<Pair<StageEdge,Map<Object,Long>>>
    Dynamic optimization pass for handling data skew. Using a map of key to partition size as a metric used for dynamic optimization, this RuntimePass identifies a number of keys with big partition sizes(skewed key) and evenly redistributes data via overwriting incoming edges of destination tasks.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • calculateKeyRanges

        public List<KeyRange> calculateKeyRanges(Map<Object,Long> keyToPartitionSizeMap,
                                         Integer dstParallelism)
        Evenly distribute the skewed data to the destination tasks. Partition denotes for a keyed portion of a Task output, whose key is a key. Using a map of key to partition size, this method groups the given partitions to a key range of partitions with approximate size of (total size of partitions / the number of tasks).
        Parameters:
        keyToPartitionSizeMap - a map of key to partition size.
        dstParallelism - the number of tasks that receive this data as input.
        Returns:
        the list of key ranges calculated.
